reviews.review_msg:
Good lecturer with minimal stutters and no accent.

I don't know why people say the lectures are boring. Just imagine its a movie, you don't need to take any notes. You can literally show up without a pencil.

The late penalties are 10% per day. I ate a lot of late penalties.

The formatting of the assignments are marked harshly.

Probably one of the worst classes I have ever taken. The lectures are boring , the content even more so. The TA's are insufferable. They cut way too many marks for very tiny details while grading rubrics are way toooo vague. Do urself a favor and take this course with any other prof.

Great professor with a good attitude but the lectures were quite boring. Not too many assignments but near the middle and the end of the course there is big papers you have to write. TAs marked very poorly and took off large chunks of your mark for the tiniest things.
Marked very thought, boring lectures, you are expected way more than what is being said, TAs take away big marks for little things. Bad experience
Pretty chills, just make sure you don't mess up the informative and persuasive papers as those are worth essentially your entire grade.
great lectures, extremely boring content, insufferable marking, final was insanely random
Probably the best MACM 101 professor out there. Practice the textbook questions a lot and really understand the assignment quizzes. They help a ton.
Amazing teacher for macm. Amazing lectures, he made everything so simple and easy to understand. Definitely take him for macm 101
Horrible prof for cmpt 105w do not take him. Class average was a b- but the other class had a a- average. Do not take him for cmpt 105w
if you have the option take him
Despite being a notoriously difficult course with hard assignments, this professor managed to make it all clear and understandable that attending every class was definitely worth every second.
Goated Prof

Amazing lectures, amazing slides. Hard assignments (4 of them, 2-3 in pairs). Fair, medium-hard exams. About same difficulty as 295 but it's okay because Harinder made this one of my favourite cmpt courses so far.
Majestic speaking voice gosh dilly darn

Best prof at SFU. Very professional and he sets the standard of what a professor should be like. Exams are fair and assignments are challenging but teach you a lot. Lecture ability is amazing and he is very accessible outside of class.

I took Harinder back in Spring 2023 (those who know, know), and his class was extremely fair. Ample time for assignments, answered questions quickly on CourSys discussion forums. Provided practice quizzes that the midterms/final were based on. Assignments were tough but rewarding. Also took CMPT 310/MACM 101 with him and enjoyed thoroughly.
Great prof!
Mr. Khangura, I love you.
This is a challenging course but he made it much easier to understand. One of the best profs I've had.
Super. His lectures were easy to understand and the TAs were helpful at the tutorials.

Very clear and straight forward lectures; content itself is difficult to learn but he makes it as easy as possible to understand. Assignment quizzes and exams were pretty hard, if you don't know something you are out of luck.
Puts effort and enthusiasm into even the most simple lectures. Cant go wrong with Dr. Khangura

Many students enjoyed his course, but I didn't. He's lectures were very good, well organized, easy to understand, but mid-term and final were NOT easy. Do read his slides. However, the assignments were very time-consuming and difficult. Guidelines are vague which were hard to direct yourself! Plus, all implemented in C.

Midterms were easier than expected, final was fair. He explains things clearly and his lectures contain great examples. He really wants everyone to pass so the exams aren't outrageously hard. MACM is known to be a tough course, so I think Khangura did a good job teaching us. If you want a good mark, make sure to do practice problems every day.
Such a great prof for MACM makes everything very clear and easy to understand. Also very accessible outside of class which is nice. Cares for his students.

His lectures are very to the point and give many examples for you to understand the subject. Although the exams were quite difficult he was extremely nice in giving out half mark. I didn't have enough time to finish the midterm completely and rushed the last 3 questions but he gave me many half marks for what i wrote down. Very nice marker!

Harinder khangura is probably my favorite prof at SFU! Clear, concise, and entertaining lectures. His quizzes, assignments, tests are fair and reflective of the amazing quality of teaching he provides. If you plan on taking macm101, taking it with another prof would be a serious mistake! Can't say enough nice things about him! Highly recommend!

He's a great professor. A mature, respectful guy who speaks concisely and clearly. He does not assign too much work for marks, with most of the work outside of class being optional practice. All the info you need is in his lecture slides.

I enjoyed Harinder for CMPT 300. I think he is one of the best when it comes to preparation for lectures. His lectures/slides are great for understanding the material. No textbook was required. As others may have mentioned, the assignments are hard. If he gives the "s-talk" assignment, be prepared to spend a lot of time researching how to do it.

CMPT 300 is a notoriously hard course, however, Harinder does a really good job keeping the material interesting . Lectures were straightforward and his notes are straight to the point. Online classes gave us the opportunity to ask questions and he is quick to reply with detailed answers. Assignments are tough so do them early!

5 quizzes worth 60%, homework worth 10% and final worth 30%. If u fail the final u fail the whole course. The quizzes had been fair except induction where he pull out some hard ones. Final was pretty hard imo, and we have different versions, apparently some versions are easier too. I would recommend this class if u do not have to write exams ;)

Love him. Patient and very helpful. Lectures are clear, concise, and engaging (you'll usually practice the code alongside him). Highly recommend him because he'll give clear explanations and examples if you're struggling. A great introduction to Python.

Harinder put so much work into making sure online classes went well. He answered so many questions and was so accessible and helpful outside of class. Everything on the course website was well organized. The notes and lectures were well done.
I usually do not have many things to say about someone who does his job perfectly. That should do it.

Amazing professor. Lectures are very well organized and he is the type of professor that is so good at explaining that you end up learning a bunch in his classes and not just catching up to deadlines and not learning a thing. Very caring and very helpful professor, assignments are brutal but normal with CMPT300. Fair exams

An absolute gem of a professor. He will go above and beyond to make you have everything you need to succeed in class. He is very easy to approach and never hesitant to repeat himself for questions. He explains difficult to understand concepts in a very clear and concise manner. Exams and assignments are fair. 100% recommend

a cute and helpful prof. His lectures are clear and helps a lot w revision. If you listen to the lecture and take good notes (i.e, your own understanding along with filling the blanks he gives), you'll do well.

THe notes are pictures so take notes.  The group project part gives no help or lectures.  Accuses of plagiarism easily and wont reply Group project participation is graded against whole class  Tricky questions like logic and codecracking and history Dont circle more than one if not needed.  Final is everything way harder and more thniking questions
Good professor, very clear and helpful
A very great prof. He is nice and helpful. He explains things very clearly. As long as you attend the classes, pay attention and study the notes, it will be an easy A for you.
Exceptionally clear speaker. Reads from PowerPoint slides. I did not use my textbook.
Awesome prof

Great Prof. Very ethical person. His classes are very interactive and interesting. Crystal clear in his explanations. encourages class discussions to make it more interesting. Without a doubt, one of the best profs at SFU.
He is a good prof for sure! However, I think he demands his students in this course too much
work hard.
interesting course.fantastic prof,speaking clearly and making difficult things really easy for u to understand!!midterms are pretty easy.
good pro.

Amazing prof. He makes things so easy to understand and is very good with answering any questions or clarifying his in-class examples. His assignments can be tough but he gives very good directions as to how to do them while still being able to teach the important lesson of the assignment.
This guy kicks ass.

I think Harinder is a good prof. His lectures are very organized and if you do not understand, you can ask him after class or in office hour. He is not an easy prof. His exams are pretty tricky. If you do well in labs and assignments, you are going to be getting B+.
very good prof!! best one i've met in cmpt and he knows his stuff very well. class notes are useful so do attend class.
No Comments
